title: Stablecoins and Crypto Cards Gain Ground in Europe's Everyday Economy
body: Stablecoins and crypto debit cards are gaining meaningful traction in Europe‚Äôs evolving financial ecosystem, with recent data showing significant growth in both internet-based settlements and everyday spending. While stablecoins now surpass traditional card networks like Visa and Mastercard in onchain volume, crypto cards are matching ‚Äî and in some areas outpacing ‚Äî banks when it comes to micro-payments and online purchases. Stablecoins Leapfrog Card Giants to Become the Internet‚Äôs Default Settlement Layer The race to own the internet‚Äôs checkout button is over‚Äîfor now. Data gathered by blockchain-infrastructure provider Alchemy shows that dollar-pegged cryptocurrencies have already pushed past Visa and Mastercard in on-chain transaction volume by roughly 7%, cementing stablecoins as the fastest-growing payment rail on the planet. Stablecoins have seen ‚Äúexplosive‚Äù adoption and are becoming the default settlement layer for the internet, Alchemy‚Äôs head of engineering Noam Hurwitz says. Behind the numbers is a simple value proposition: near-instant, borderless transfers that cost a fraction of a cent and clear 24/7‚Äîfeatures legacy card networks still struggle to match. The result, Hurwitz added, is a decisive shift in how money moves online. PayPal, Stripe and Visa have all embedded stablecoin rails to trim costs and speed up settlement, effectively hiding the blockchain complexity behind familiar user interfaces. By leaning on Alchemy‚Äôs APIs, these firms can decouple the user experience from the underlying technology while gaining real-time finality, Hurwitz explained. A Trillion-Dollar Liquidity Pool in Treasurys One knock-on effect of stablecoin growth is a massive new buyer of US debt. Market leader Tether (USDT) generated an estimated $13 billion in profit last year and now holds roughly $113 billion in US Treasurys‚Äîmore than the government of Germany. Those reserve-backed holdings anchor the broader tokenized-finance stack, Hurwitz noted, turning tokenized money into the bedrock of an emerging on-chain economy. Momentum accelerated on June 17 when the US Senate passed the bipartisan Guiding and Establishing National Innovation for US Stablecoins Act (GENIUS Act). The bill creates a federal licensing regime for issuers and removes much of the legal gray area that has kept banks and payment giants on the sidelines. Industry lawyers say the legislation could be signed into law before year-end, providing a clear runway for further institutional adoption. Traditional finance isn‚Äôt standing still. J.P. Morgan‚Äôs blockchain unit Kinexys is piloting a permissioned USD deposit token‚ÄîJPMD‚Äîon Coinbase‚Äôs Layer-2 network Base. The project promises interest-bearing balances, real-time liquidity and 24-hour settlement for corporate treasuries, positioning bank-issued tokens as a ‚Äúsuperior alternative to stablecoins ‚Äù for some clients. Fragmented Chains and UX Hurdles Remain Despite eye-popping throughput, the stablecoin landscape is still fragmented across multiple blockchains. Enterprises must vet each network‚Äôs reliability, liquidity depth and counter-party risk‚Äîno trivial task for treasury teams used to a single clearing house. Hurwitz argues that the next wave of adoption will come from Layer-2 networks purpose-built for individual platforms, stitched together by seamless cross-chain bridges. However, not everyone is sold on the idea that privately issued tokens can serve as ‚Äúmoney.‚Äù In its 2025 Annual Economic Report, the Bank for International Settlements said stablecoins fail crucial tests of singleness, elasticity and integrity, likening them to 19th-century banknotes that sometimes traded at discounts. The BIS instead backs central-bank digital currencies and tokenized deposits as safer foundations for digital finance. Layer-2s and Interoperability Alchemy expects most financial-services firms to launch their own Layer-2 chains over the next five years, each monetizing niche ecosystems while relying on stablecoins for final settlement. If cross-chain interoperability matures as quickly as liquidity has, stablecoins could underpin a more connected, always-on financial web‚Äîone where swapping tokenized dollars for tokenized securities or real-world assets happens in a single click, anywhere on Earth. Crypto Cards Challenge Banks for the Checkout Crown in Europe In related news, data from CEX.IO and other payment providers show digital-asset cards closing the gap with ‚Äî and in key areas beating ‚Äî traditional banks at Europe‚Äôs point of sale. Europe‚Äôs long-running love affair with cash is fading fastest at the lower end of the purchase spectrum, and crypto cards are seizing the moment. According to a 2025 spend-pattern survey released by London-based exchange CEX.IO, 45 percent of all crypto-linked card transactions in the region are for less than ‚Ç¨10. That tiny-ticket share rivals the cozy hold cash once enjoyed at corner bakeries, newsstands and transit kiosks, and now outpaces the slice claimed by debit- and credit-card issuers backed by high-street banks. The report arrives as the number of newly issued CEX.IO cards jumped 15 percent year-to-date, hinting that Europeans are warming to the idea of spending stablecoins and mainstream crypto assets the same way they swipe or tap a bank card. Digital natives aren‚Äôt just tapping in caf√©s. They‚Äôre checking out online at a pace traditional cards have yet to match. While European Central Bank data show that 21 percent of all euro-area card payments are remote, CEX.IO‚Äôs customers conduct 40 percent of their transactions over the internet. The elevated e-commerce usage mirrors findings from rivals Oobit and Crypto.com, both of which have logged outsized crypto-card traffic at online retailers, airline sites and app stores. Where the Money Goes: Groceries, Dining and Daily Life Far from the crypto-luxury stereotype, most purchases are decidedly ordinary. The average crypto-card transaction clocks in at ‚Ç¨23.70, meaning users are reaching for digital assets to buy sandwiches and detergent more often than big-ticket electronics. By comparison, Mastercard pegs the average European bank-card purchase at ‚Ç¨33.60. Behind the scenes, stablecoins fund roughly 73 percent of purchases, confirming their rise as a low-volatility medium for everyday exchange. Yet holders still dip into more volatile assets: Bitcoin, Ether, Litecoin and Solana collectively account for a quarter of grocery, dining and transport payments in the dataset. The asset mix underscores consumers‚Äô willingness to spend, not just hoard, their crypto. Cryptocurrencies used for purchases (Source: CEX.IO) A Cashless Future, One Tap at a Time ‚ÄúWhat we‚Äôre seeing in Europe is that crypto-card users aren‚Äôt just experimenting with new tech ‚Äî they‚Äôre forming the habits that will define a truly cashless future,‚Äù said Alexandr Kerya, vice-president of product management at CEX.IO. He noted that average monthly payment volume across the company‚Äôs cardholders rose 24 percent in May alone, even as price volatility remained muted. Crypto card spending distribution (Source: CEX.IO) Those habits are reinforced by a wave of new offerings. Kraken and Mastercard launched a co-branded debit card last year; meme-coin ecosystem Floki followed suit with a 13-asset card this spring. Fintechs have responded by deepening rewards programs and upping transaction limits, hoping to keep pace with a customer base that clearly values immediate settlement and blockchain transparency. Not everyone is cheering. UK banking giant Barclays announced it will block crypto purchases on Barclaycard credit lines starting next month, citing fears of unsustainable debt loads and the absence of investor protections. The lender warned customers that digital-asset transactions fall outside the safety net of the Financial Ombudsman Service and the Financial Services Compensation Scheme. The move signals a widening philosophical divide: fintechs lean on real-time blockchain settlement to reduce fraud and chargebacks, whereas legacy banks remain wary of an asset class still navigating regulatory scrutiny and sharp market swings. The Road to Parity ‚Äî and Beyond Three trends suggest crypto cards could soon match, or surpass, traditional bank cards across more spending categories: 1. Merchant Acceptance Large payment processors now route crypto authorization through the same EMV rails they use for fiat transactions, minimizing friction for shops and restaurants. 2. Regulatory Clarity The European Union‚Äôs Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) framework rolls out this year, creating a passportable license that card issuers can leverage continent-wide. 3. Stablecoin Maturity With tokenized euros and CBDC pilots advancing, volatility concerns around crypto payments may recede, opening the door for payroll deposits and utility billing. If those forces converge, crypto cards might not just rival bank plastics for micro-spending; they could become the default in a post-cash Europe‚Äîone tap, scan or click at a time.

title: South Korea halts CBDC project as regulators prioritize won-backed stablecoin rollout
body: South Korea‚Äôs central bank digital currency project has been put on hold as the regulators turn their attention to fast-tracking the issuance of won-backed stablecoins. According to a Bloomberg report citing an unnamed Bank of Korea official, the central bank has suspended plans for the second phase of its CBDC pilot, which had been scheduled for the fourth quarter of 2025. Participating banks have reportedly been informed that discussions would be temporarily paused. Authorities are reevaluating the role of a CBDC as they are pivoting toward regulating private stablecoin issuers, the official noted. The Bank of Korea had been preparing to expand its CBDC testing under ‚ÄúProject Han River,‚Äù which began earlier this year with a consortium of seven banks. The second phase was expected to include features such as peer-to-peer transfers and merchant payments. However, banks reportedly raised concerns over high costs and the lack of a clear commercialization plan, prompting the central bank to reassess the project‚Äôs future. Instead, the central bank will continue to monitor progress on a legislative proposal that would establish a regulatory framework for Korean won-based stablecoins. The proposed legislation, introduced under the Digital Asset Basic Act , outlines licensing requirements for issuers and includes provisions for reserve management and user protection. You might also like: South Korean stocks ride crypto wave as new president backs won-based tokens The move aligns with President Lee Jae-myung‚Äôs broader agenda to accelerate stablecoin development . Since taking office earlier this month, Lee has prioritised the institutionalisation of KRW-backed digital tokens as a strategic financial initiative. His administration supports a licensing regime that would permit companies with as little as ‚Ç©500 million ($370,000) in equity capital to issue stablecoins, subject to regulatory approval. Democratic Party leaders have framed the rollout of won-denominated stablecoins as essential to preserving South Korea‚Äôs monetary sovereignty. Party lawmakers argue that local crypto markets are overly reliant on U.S. dollar-pegged assets like USDT and USDC, and warn that continued dominance by foreign stablecoins could undermine domestic financial policy. These stablecoins reportedly accounted for over ‚Ç©57 trillion ($42 billion) in trading volume during the first quarter of 2025. Min Byeong-deok, head of the Digital Asset Committee, has warned that without swift action, Korea may lag in the race for stablecoin leadership. He contends that the market for stablecoins could surpass even artificial intelligence or semiconductors and has called for regulatory measures to support issuance by compliant entities. Commercial banks have already responding to this policy shift. Eight of the country‚Äôs largest banks, including KB Kookmin, Shinhan, Woori, and Nonghyup, have launched a joint initiative to issue a KRW-pegged stablecoin. title: Best token to hold till 2026? This $0.03 project outpaces top 20 coins
body: In a market flooded with big-cap tokens like Ethereum, BNB, and Solana, most top 20 coins have already seen their biggest moves‚Äîwhile one $0.03 altcoin is just getting started. Mutuum Finance (MUTM) , currently in Phase 5 of its presale with 50% already sold, is gaining attention for doing what others no longer can: offering serious upside from an early entry point. One early investor who entered Phase 1 at $0.01 with $6,000 has already seen his position grow to $18,000‚Äîup 200%. He plans to hold through to 2026, targeting a $1.50 to $2.00 price post-launch. If that happens, his original $6,000 could become $300,000 to $400,000, and he‚Äôs already calling it his ‚Äúearly retirement play.‚Äù Mutuum‚Äôs upcoming beta platform launch, real DeFi lending model, and expected listings on top exchanges are fueling long-term confidence. If you‚Äôre seeing this at $0.03, you‚Äôre already late to Phase 1, 2, 3, and 4‚Äîand this price won‚Äôt return. Tokenomics built to reward long-term commitment Mutuum Finance (MUTM) is introducing one of the most dynamic systems in the DeFi lending market, where every function is designed to push value back to its ecosystem participants. At the heart of it lies the mtToken model‚Äîa mechanism that will turn idle deposits into yield-generating, multi-use instruments. When users contribute crypto assets into lending pools, they will receive mtTokens representing their position. These tokens will grow in value as borrowers tap into the liquidity, allowing holders to watch their interest compound without ever needing to claim it manually. Beyond interest accrual, mtTokens will also serve as collateral for new borrowing opportunities, creating active use cases for otherwise passive holdings. This flexibility will give users more options to generate returns and manage risk while maintaining full ownership of their assets. And for those looking to maximize value, staking mtTokens in designated contracts will unlock access to protocol revenue distribution. A portion of all fees earned by the protocol will be used to purchase MUTM tokens on the open market and redistribute them to active mtToken stakers, creating a cycle of steady demand and consistent token redistribution. The token supply will be 4 billion units, limiting dilution and supporting long-term value preservation. No inflation, no arbitrary unlock schedules‚Äîjust a clean, utility-driven model backed by real DeFi mechanics. For investors looking to hold through the next cycle, this structure offers far more upside than overbought Top 20 assets already sitting near multi-billion-dollar valuations. title: Metaplanet Shares Jump Nearly 10% After New $108 Million Bitcoin Buy
body: Tokyo-listed investment firm, Metaplanet,¬†has once again expanded its Bitcoin reserves with the purchase of 1,005 BTC for approximately $108 million. The latest acquisition has pushed its total holdings to 13,350 BTC, surpassing CleanSpark to become the fifth-largest publicly traded corporate holder of Bitcoin. Metaplanet Expands Bitcoin Stash In a statement, the company‚Äôs CEO, Simon Gerovich, disclosed it paid an average of around $107,601 per BTC in its latest purchase, with the total stash currently valued near $1.45 billion at current market rates. The acquisition aligns with Metaplanet‚Äôs accelerated Bitcoin accumulation strategy, which was revised earlier this year with ambitions to amass over 210,000 BTC by the end of 2027. The exec also added, ‚ÄúJust 3 months ago, we announced live at our shareholder meeting that we hit 3,350 BTC ‚Äì and now we‚Äôve added 10,000 more to reach 13,350 BTC.‚Äù The firm‚Äôs Bitcoin purchase was financed in part through the issuance of ¬•30 billion ($208 million) in zero-coupon, non-interest-bearing bonds, which is scheduled to mature in December 2025, which aligns with its ongoing approach to using debt and equity channels to fund BTC buys while simultaneously conducting bond buybacks to optimize its capital structure. According to its disclosures, the company said that it aims to maintain a shareholder-aligned approach by tracking a proprietary BTC yield metric, measuring Bitcoin per fully diluted share, which has sharply increased following the latest purchase. The company has logged a quarter-to-date BTC yield of over 129%. Metaplanet‚Äôs shares responded positively to the development. It rose nearly 10% on the day of the announcement in Tokyo, and continued a rally that has seen its stock climb over 350% year-to-date. Climbing Corporate Bitcoin Leaderboard According to the leaderboard updated by BitcoinTreasuries, Metaplanet is currently trailing behind Strategy, Marathon Digital, Twenty One Capital, and Riot Platforms, which currently hold 592,345 BTC, 49,179 BTC, 37,229.7 BTC, and 19,225 BTC, respectively. The company had recently left Tesla behind just last week, following continued aggressive accumulation. The post Metaplanet Shares Jump Nearly 10% After New $108 Million Bitcoin Buy appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: The Great Transfer of Wealth from Bitcoin to Altcoins Has Begun
body: Only 8% of altcoins (excluding stablecoins) have outperformed BTC over a rolling 90-day period. After two years of relentless underperformance against Bitcoin, altcoins are now showing a level of historic weakness that has, in the past, been the prelude to a major market reversal. title: Authors Launch Crucial Battle Against AI in Publishing
body: BitcoinWorld Authors Launch Crucial Battle Against AI in Publishing In the rapidly evolving digital landscape, where artificial intelligence continues to reshape industries, a significant conflict is brewing in the literary world. For those deeply entrenched in the world of cryptocurrencies and decentralized technologies, the parallels might be striking: questions of ownership, fair compensation, and the impact of automation on human creativity are at the forefront. This time, it‚Äôs not about blockchain‚Äôs disruption but AI‚Äôs profound influence on content creation, particularly within AI in publishing , prompting a united front from renowned authors. What‚Äôs Fueling the Authors‚Äô Outcry Against AI in Publishing? A powerful collective of authors, including literary giants like Lauren Groff, Lev Grossman, R.F. Kuang, Dennis Lehane, and Geoffrey Maguire, has issued an urgent open letter to book publishers. Their primary demand is a clear commitment to limit the use of AI tools in the publishing process. This isn‚Äôt just a minor grievance; it‚Äôs a fundamental challenge to the growing integration of AI into creative industries, sparking a vital conversation about the ethics and economics of artificial intelligence. The letter, which initially garnered an impressive list of signatories, quickly gained momentum. Reports from NPR highlighted that an additional 1,100 signatures were added within just 24 hours of its initial publication, underscoring the widespread concern among the writing community. This swift and substantial support signals a deep-seated apprehension about AI‚Äôs trajectory in their field, emphasizing the collective desire to protect human artistry and livelihood. Protecting Author Rights in the Digital Age: Key Demands At the heart of the authors‚Äô appeal lies a strong stance on protecting author rights . They articulate several specific pledges they want publishers to make, aiming to draw a clear line in the sand regarding AI‚Äôs permissible role: Human Audiobook Narrators: A commitment to exclusively hire human narrators for audiobooks, preserving a crucial avenue of work for voice artists and ensuring the nuanced performance that only human interpretation can provide. No AI-Created Books: A pledge that publishers will never release books that have been entirely created by machine. This demand directly confronts the notion of AI as a primary creative force in literature, advocating for human authorship as the bedrock of publishing. Safeguarding Human Staff: A promise not to replace human staff with AI tools or degrade their positions into mere AI monitors. This addresses concerns about job displacement and the devaluing of human expertise within publishing houses. These demands reflect a broader concern about the preservation of human creativity and the integrity of the literary ecosystem. Authors fear a future where their contributions are marginalized or entirely replaced by algorithms, diminishing the value of their unique voice and effort. The Shadow of Generative AI: Is Work Being ‚ÄúStolen‚Äù? A core argument presented in the open letter revolves around the perceived ‚Äútheft‚Äù of authors‚Äô work by AI companies. The letter powerfully states: ‚ÄúRather than paying writers a small percentage of the money our work makes for them, someone else will be paid for a technology built on our unpaid labor.‚Äù This statement points directly to the controversial practice of training large language models (LLMs) and other generative AI systems on vast datasets of existing copyrighted material, often without explicit permission or compensation to the original creators. The issue here is not just about direct plagiarism but about the fundamental input that fuels AI‚Äôs capabilities. If AI models learn to generate text, stories, or even narrative styles by processing millions of human-authored books, authors argue that their creative output is being used as raw material for commercial gain without any form of acknowledgment or remuneration. This raises complex ethical questions about intellectual property in the age of advanced algorithms and the future of creative compensation. Navigating AI Copyright Battles: Legal Challenges and Setbacks Beyond open letters and public appeals, authors have also pursued legal avenues to address their concerns regarding AI. Numerous lawsuits have been filed against tech companies, alleging that their books were used without authorization to train AI models. These legal battles are crucial in defining the boundaries of AI copyright and intellectual property in the digital age. However, the path to legal victory has proven challenging. Earlier this week, federal judges dealt significant blows to some of these lawsuits, highlighting the complex and often ambiguous nature of existing copyright law when applied to AI training data. These setbacks underscore the urgent need for clearer legal frameworks and industry standards that can adequately address the novel challenges posed by AI‚Äôs rapid development. The outcomes of these cases will set precedents that could profoundly impact how creative works are protected and compensated in the future. Shaping the Future of Publishing: A Collaborative Path Forward? The debate sparked by authors‚Äô demands is not merely about resistance to new technology; it‚Äôs about shaping the future of publishing in a way that respects human creativity and ensures fair compensation. While AI offers potential efficiencies, the authors‚Äô letter emphasizes the irreplaceable value of human ingenuity, emotional depth, and lived experience that underpins compelling storytelling. This ongoing dialogue between authors, publishers, and tech companies is critical. It necessitates a collaborative approach to establish ethical guidelines, fair compensation models, and transparent practices for AI integration. Publishers face the challenge of leveraging technological advancements while upholding their commitment to creators. The authors‚Äô collective voice serves as a powerful reminder that the foundation of the publishing industry‚Äîand indeed, all creative industries‚Äîrests on the unique contributions of human talent. A Pivotal Moment for Creativity and Technology The authors‚Äô urgent call to action marks a pivotal moment in the ongoing conversation about artificial intelligence and its impact on creative fields. It highlights deep-seated concerns over compensation, intellectual property, and the very definition of authorship in an increasingly automated world. As AI continues to advance, the tension between technological innovation and the preservation of human creative value will only intensify. The outcome of these discussions and legal battles will not only shape the future of publishing but also set a precedent for how all creative industries navigate the profound shifts brought about by artificial intelligence. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI Models‚Äô future features. This post Authors Launch Crucial Battle Against AI in Publishing first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Ric Edelman Urges Financial Advisors to Consider Up to 40% Crypto Allocations
body: Veteran financial advisor Ric Edelman is challenging traditional portfolio guidance, asking advisors to recommend crypto allocations as high as 40%. Key Takeaways: Ric Edelman now recommends crypto allocations of up to 40%, a shift from his 1% guidance. He says Bitcoin‚Äôs mainstream adoption has resolved past uncertainties. Crypto‚Äôs uncorrelated performance can boost diversification. ‚ÄúToday I am saying 40%, that‚Äôs astonishing,‚Äù Edelman told CNBC‚Äôs Crypto World this week. ‚ÄúNo one has ever said such a thing.‚Äù In his 2021 book The Truth About Crypto , Edelman suggested allocations as low as 1% were appropriate, reflecting the uncertainties that clouded the market just a few years ago. Edelman: Crypto‚Äôs Rise Justifies 40% Allocation Edelman, who leads the Digital Assets Council of Financial Professionals, said the dramatic change stems from what he described as the industry‚Äôs transformation. ‚ÄúFour years ago, we didn‚Äôt know if governments would ban Bitcoin, if the technology would fail, or if institutions would adopt it,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúToday, all those questions have been resolved. It‚Äôs radically changed and is now a mainstream asset.‚Äù Signs of crypto‚Äôs mainstream arrival are evident in the surge of inflows into spot bitcoin ETFs, which have pulled in billions this year and are among the top-performing asset classes for new investments. The influx has put crypto firmly on the radar of advisors and institutional investors. Edelman also highlighted a broader trend reshaping investment strategy: the erosion of the traditional 60/40 portfolio split between stocks and bonds. Longer life expectancies, with projections suggesting people could live to 100 in coming decades, mean that retirees will need higher returns for longer periods. ‚ÄúToday‚Äôs 60-year-old is kind of like yesterday‚Äôs 30-year-old,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúYou need to get better returns than you can get from bonds and you need to hold equities longer than ever before.‚Äù In this environment, Edelman argued, crypto‚Äôs role becomes indispensable. He pointed out that Bitcoin‚Äôs price movements are uncorrelated with traditional assets, making it a powerful diversification tool that can enhance portfolio risk-adjusted returns. ‚ÄúThe crypto asset class offers the opportunity for higher returns than you‚Äôre likely to get in virtually any other asset class,‚Äù he said. Edelman Calls Bitcoin Price Forecasts Conservative With some market watchers forecasting bitcoin prices could reach $150,000-$250,000 by year-end ‚Äî and even $500,000 by the end of the decade ‚Äî Edelman called these projections ‚Äúconservative‚Äù compared to other bullish estimates. As reported, Shunyet Jan, Head of Derivatives at Bybit, has projected that Bitcoin could reach $125,000 by the end of Q2 if current trends persist. Likewise, crypto analyst Scott Melker has said he believes Bitcoin could surge to $250,000 by the end of 2025 , driven by institutional demand and a maturing market structure. Despite growing interest in Bitcoin, not everyone in traditional finance is convinced of its long-term staying power. As reported, Eric Semler, chairman of Semler Scientific, has said that many hedge funds remain skeptical about Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term viability, believing it may lose momentum after the Trump administration. The post Ric Edelman Urges Financial Advisors to Consider Up to 40% Crypto Allocations appeared first on Cryptonews .

From that point forward, the platform is expected to transition into full utility in Phase 4, activating key functions including real-time borrowing, mtToken staking, and stablecoin deployment. The $100,000 giveaway ‚Äîsplit among ten early supporters‚Äîhas already sparked considerable traction, building a community that has grown beyond 10,000 followers across social platforms. This base will continue to expand as new users realize that Mutuum Finance (MUTM) isn‚Äôt promising a hypothetical use case‚Äîit‚Äôs preparing to launch with the infrastructure already planned and audited. title: Arbitrum eyes rally to $1 as Robinhood partnership rumors gain traction
body: Arbitrum could be positioned for a major rally if it confirms a breakout from a long-forming bullish reversal pattern. According to data from crypto.news, Arbitrum ( ARB ) surged nearly 46% to an intraday high of $0.38 before retracing slightly to $0.35 at press time. Its market capitalization climbed above $1.7 billion, overtaking tokens like Sky ( SKY ), Render ( RENDER ), and Sei ( SEI ) in the rankings. The rally occurred in a high-volume trading environment. CoinGecko data shows that ARB‚Äôs daily spot trading volume jumped over 450% in the past 24 hours, with $658 million worth of tokens changing hands. Derivatives activity also surged, up 42% from the previous day, while a long/short ratio above 1 across major exchanges suggests bullish positioning among leveraged traders. Much of the recent momentum has been driven by growing speculation that Robinhood may tap Arbitrum to develop a blockchain infrastructure enabling EU-based users to trade U.S. equities onchain. Earlier reports suggested that Robinhood was evaluating both Arbitrum and Solana as candidates, though final decisions were still pending. You might also like: NFT sales reach $125m, Ethereum dethrones Polygon Investor buzz picked up after Robinhood announced that its Crypto GM, Johann Kerbrat, and A.J. Warner, CSO of Offchain Labs, the non-profit that stewards Arbitrum ecosystem governance, will join Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin for a fireside chat on Monday. The event, hosted by Robinhood Europe in Cannes, is being hyped as the stage for the company‚Äôs biggest crypto announcements of the year. The development comes shortly after Arbitrum was selected by crypto exchange Gemini as the settlement layer for its tokenized shares of Strategy‚Äôs MSTR stock, with plans to expand to additional assets and networks over time. Beyond fundamentals and headlines, on-chain indicators further support the bullish case. Data from Santiment shows a sharp uptick in daily active addresses on the Arbitrum network alongside a shift in social sentiment from negative to positive, both typically seen as precursors to sustained price rallies. Source: Santiment Arbitrum price analysis On the 1-day/USDT price chart, ARB is nearing the upper boundary of a large falling wedge pattern that has been developing since January of last year. A confirmed breakout above this resistance trendline would likely signal the end of its long-term downtrend and the beginning of a new bullish phase. ARB price, 50-day EMA chart ‚Äî June 30 | Source: crypto.news The token currently trades above its 50-day exponential moving average, indicating strengthening medium-term bullish momentum. Additionally, momentum indicators support this view, most notably, the MACD has flipped into positive territory, suggesting a shift in trend direction. ARB MACD and Aroon chart ‚Äî June 30 | Source: crypto.news The Aroon Up indicator stands at 92.86%, while the Aroon Down is at 42.86% which points to a strong uptrend with declining bearish pressure, typically seen in early stages of trend reversals. If the breakout from the wedge is confirmed, the next likely upside target for ARB lies at $0.75, which corresponds with the 23.6% Fibonacci retracement level drawn from the macro high to recent lows. A clean breakout from that level could set it up for a rally to $1, which would represent gains of 185% from the current levels. title: XRP Army Reacts As Massive Whale Abruptly Moves 300 Million XRP At Once
body: A massive XRP transaction has sent shockwaves through the crypto community. According to Whale Alert, a leading blockchain tracking service, 320 million XRP, valued at approximately $703.5 million, was abruptly moved on June 30 between two unknown wallets. The scale of the transfer, and the fact that both the sender and recipient remain unidentified have stirred intense speculation among XRP holders and analysts. The transfer came at a pivotal time for XRP, which has recently been trading around $2.18 amid growing expectations of a breakout. With the long-running legal battle between Ripple and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) winding down, following Ripple‚Äôs withdrawal of its counter-appeal and the SEC likely to follow suit , many believe this transfer is more than a routine transaction. 320,000,000 #XRP (703,517,724 USD) transferred from unknown wallet to unknown wallet https://t.co/EzDk6g8ZUw ‚Äî Whale Alert (@whale_alert) June 30, 2025 XRP Community Reacts to the Whale Movement Members of the XRP Army were quick to react across social media platforms, particularly on X, where theories and opinions flooded in. Crypto Head commented, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a serious bag. Wonder if it‚Äôs cold storage or someone gearing up for something big.‚Äù His post echoed a common theme‚Äîuncertainty over whether this was simply a custodial move or a strategic setup for a major event. Blue Hawk Legend, another known XRP commentator, rejected the idea of retail whales : ‚ÄúPeople think these are whales? This is an institution.‚Äù The notion that large financial entities are increasingly involved in XRP-related activity is gaining traction, especially given Ripple‚Äôs expanding presence in cross-border payments and tokenization. DanteGPU weighed in, stating, ‚ÄúWhoever moved that bag is playing in a different league,‚Äù a sentiment that captures the awe surrounding such a high-value transaction. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Others responded with curiosity or irony. ‚ÄúWe have XRP movements?‚Äù asked Logic, alluding to XRP‚Äôs relatively quiet trading behavior in recent weeks. Meanwhile, Max ACS bluntly asked, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the whale doing?‚Äù, a question many in the community are still trying to answer. Institutional Moves or Strategic Repositioning? While on-chain whale activity is a common feature of the crypto market, the movement of over 300 million XRP in a single transaction raises eyebrows. Given XRP‚Äôs utility in enterprise-level payment solutions and its ongoing integration into Ripple‚Äôs liquidity infrastructure, this may represent internal wallet consolidation, preparation for institutional custody, or positioning ahead of regulatory clarity. The timing adds intrigue. With the Ripple vs. SEC case reaching a practical conclusion and optimism growing around XRP‚Äôs legal status, this large movement may signal readiness for a more liquid and accessible XRP market, particularly for institutional participants. The wallets involved haven‚Äôt been identified yet, and neither Ripple nor any major exchange has made a public comment. But one thing is certain: a $703 million shift doesn‚Äôt go unnoticed. Whether it‚Äôs a precursor to market action or just a routine transfer, the XRP community and the wider crypto world will be watching closely. Disclaimer : This content is meant to inform and should not be considered financial advice. The views expressed in this article may include the author‚Äôs personal opinions and do not represent Times Tabloid‚Äôs opinion. Readers are urged to do in-depth research before making any investment decisions. Any action taken by the reader is strictly at their own risk. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. title: OpenAI‚Äôs Fierce Battle: Recalibrating Compensation Amidst Meta‚Äôs Aggressive AI Talent Poaching
body: BitcoinWorld OpenAI‚Äôs Fierce Battle: Recalibrating Compensation Amidst Meta‚Äôs Aggressive AI Talent Poaching In the rapidly evolving landscape of artificial intelligence, the battle for top minds is reaching a fever pitch. For anyone invested in the future of technology, including the burgeoning cryptocurrency space which heavily relies on AI advancements, the ongoing struggle between industry giants like OpenAI and Meta is a development of crucial importance. Recent reports indicate that OpenAI is taking drastic measures, ‚Äòrecalibrating‚Äô its compensation structures, in direct response to Meta‚Äôs aggressive recruitment of its senior researchers. This isn‚Äôt just about salaries; it‚Äôs a high-stakes tech talent war that will shape the very trajectory of AI innovation. OpenAI‚Äôs Urgent Response: Recalibrating Compensation The urgency of the situation at OpenAI became palpable with a leaked internal memo from Chief Research Officer Mark Chen. He conveyed a ‚Äúvisceral feeling‚Äù of invasion, stating, ‚Äúas if someone has broken into our home and stolen something.‚Äù This emotional response underscores the perceived threat from Meta‚Äôs poaching spree. In a swift counter-move, Chen assured team members that leadership, including CEO Sam Altman, has not been ‚Äústanding idly by.‚Äù The core of OpenAI ‚Äòs defensive strategy revolves around adjusting its compensation strategies . Chen confirmed that leaders have been working ‚Äúaround the clock to talk to those with offers,‚Äù indicating a direct, personalized effort to retain at-risk talent. The phrase ‚Äúrecalibrating comp‚Äù suggests a significant overhaul of their pay scales and incentive programs, likely involving enhanced base salaries, more lucrative equity packages, and potentially new performance bonuses designed to match or exceed rival offers. Beyond just monetary adjustments, OpenAI is also ‚Äúscoping out creative ways to recognize and reward top talent,‚Äù which could include greater autonomy, specialized research budgets, or enhanced career development opportunities. Meta‚Äôs Aggressive Play: The Hunt for Top AI Talent Over the past week, numerous reports have highlighted the exodus of at least eight key researchers from OpenAI to Meta . This aggressive recruitment drive by Meta signals its serious intent to ramp up its own AI capabilities, particularly in areas like generative AI and large language models, which are critical for its metaverse ambitions and broader product roadmap. The competition for specialized AI talent is fierce, driven by the scarcity of individuals with the unique blend of theoretical knowledge, practical experience, and research acumen required to push the boundaries of the field. The intensity of this tech talent war was further illuminated by Sam Altman‚Äôs public comments. He reportedly complained on a podcast that Meta was offering ‚Äú100 million dollar signing bonuses,‚Äù a staggering figure that, while Meta executives have internally pushed back against its accuracy, illustrates the extreme financial incentives being deployed. Such figures, even if exaggerated, highlight the extraordinary value placed on individuals who can unlock groundbreaking AI advancements. This kind of aggressive recruitment can create a ripple effect across the entire AI ecosystem, driving up costs and making it harder for smaller startups to compete. Why is AI Talent So Valuable in Today‚Äôs Market? The demand for specialized AI talent far outstrips supply, making these professionals arguably the most sought-after in the global job market. But what makes them so invaluable? It boils down to several critical factors: Scarcity of Expertise: Deep learning, neural networks, natural language processing, and computer vision require highly specialized knowledge and years of dedicated research. There are simply not enough experts to fill the burgeoning demand from tech giants, research labs, and startups alike. Transformative Impact: AI is not just another technology; it‚Äôs a foundational layer that is reshaping every industry, from healthcare and finance to entertainment and, notably, decentralized technologies like blockchain. Top AI talent can create products and services that redefine markets and generate immense value. Competitive Advantage: In a rapidly advancing field, being first to market with a breakthrough AI model or application can confer a significant competitive advantage. Companies are willing to pay a premium to secure the individuals who can deliver these innovations. Research and Development: Leading AI talent are not just engineers; they are often researchers capable of fundamental scientific breakthroughs. Their work contributes to patents, academic publications, and the overall intellectual property of a company. This high demand drives the escalating compensation strategies we are witnessing, as companies vie for a finite pool of exceptional individuals. The Broader Implications of the Tech Talent War The specific skirmish between OpenAI and Meta is a microcosm of a much larger tech talent war unfolding globally. This competition has profound implications beyond just the two companies involved: Impact on Startups: Smaller AI startups often struggle to compete with the vast resources of tech giants. They cannot match the multi-million dollar offers, making it difficult to attract and retain the very talent they need to innovate and grow. This could lead to a consolidation of AI power within a few large corporations. Wage Inflation: The aggressive bidding for AI talent drives up salaries across the board, affecting compensation benchmarks for AI professionals everywhere. While good for individual researchers, it can strain the budgets of even well-funded companies. Innovation Concentration: If top talent congregates in a few large companies, it could potentially limit the diversity of research directions and the pace of innovation outside these centralized hubs. However, large companies also have the resources to fund ambitious, long-term projects. Ethical Considerations: The intense focus on acquiring talent for competitive advantage might sometimes overshadow broader ethical considerations in AI development, as companies prioritize speed and market dominance. Understanding these broader implications is crucial for anyone monitoring the future of technology and its societal impact. Beyond Compensation: Retaining Top AI Talent While compensation strategies are a primary battleground in this tech talent war , leading companies like OpenAI know that money alone isn‚Äôt always enough to retain the best AI talent . Highly skilled researchers are often motivated by more than just salary. What else might be at play? Mission and Impact: Many top AI researchers are driven by the desire to work on projects that have a significant impact on the world, solve complex problems, or contribute to scientific advancement. A compelling mission can be a powerful draw. Research Freedom and Resources: The ability to pursue novel research directions, access cutting-edge computing resources, and collaborate with other world-class experts is invaluable. A restrictive environment, even with high pay, can be a deterrent. Culture and Collaboration: A supportive, intellectually stimulating, and collaborative work environment where ideas are freely exchanged and respected is highly valued. The opportunity to learn from and grow with peers is a major factor. Career Growth and Development: Clear pathways for advancement, opportunities to lead projects, and access to ongoing learning and development programs can encourage long-term commitment. Work-Life Balance: While intense periods are common in tech, a company‚Äôs approach to sustainable work practices and employee well-being can also influence retention, especially for seasoned professionals. OpenAI ‚Äòs commitment to ‚Äúscoping out creative ways to recognize and reward top talent‚Äù suggests they are looking beyond mere financial incentives to build a more robust retention strategy. Implications for the Future of AI Innovation The outcome of this intense competition for AI talent will undoubtedly shape the future trajectory of AI innovation. If OpenAI successfully retains its core researchers through enhanced compensation strategies and other incentives, it can continue to drive its ambitious research agenda, potentially leading to further breakthroughs in areas like AGI (Artificial General Intelligence). Conversely, if Meta ‚Äòs aggressive poaching continues unabated, it could significantly bolster its own AI capabilities, leading to increased competition in key AI application areas and potentially shifting the balance of power in the industry. This dynamic also highlights the growing importance of ethical considerations in AI development. As companies race to acquire talent and deploy powerful AI models, the need for responsible AI practices, safety protocols, and transparent development becomes even more critical. The tech talent war is not just about who builds the next big thing, but also about who builds it responsibly and for the benefit of society. Conclusion: A Defining Moment in AI‚Äôs Evolution The reported ‚Äòrecalibration‚Äô of compensation by OpenAI in response to Meta ‚Äòs aggressive hiring is a clear indicator of the intensity of the current AI talent war . This battle for the brightest minds in artificial intelligence is not merely an internal corporate affair; it‚Äôs a defining moment for the entire tech industry. The strategies employed by giants like OpenAI and Meta , particularly their compensation strategies , will set precedents for how highly skilled professionals are valued and how innovation is pursued in this crucial field. As AI continues to integrate into every facet of our lives, including the foundational technologies of the digital economy, the ability to attract and retain top AI talent will remain paramount for any organization aiming to lead the charge. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI models and institutional adoption. This post OpenAI‚Äôs Fierce Battle: Recalibrating Compensation Amidst Meta‚Äôs Aggressive AI Talent Poaching first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: The Blockchain Group Bolsters Bitcoin Holdings and Capital Base
body: The Blockchain Group (ALTBG) announced a series of strategic moves enhancing both its bitcoin treasury BTC and capital structure. The Paris-based company bought 60 BTC for about 5.5 million euros ($6.5 million), bringing its total holdings to 1,788 BTC valued at about 161.3 million euros, with an average price of 90,213 euros each. Notable transactions include Blockstream CEO Adam Back subscribing to over 2.1 million new shares for around 1.16 million euros, and French asset manager TOBAM subscribing to some 262,605 new shares for just under 143,000 euros, enabling the purchase of 13 BTC. The company exercised warrants called BSA 2025-01, issuing over 1.1 million new shares and raising about 600,00 in fresh funds, which were then used to acquire 6 BTC. Additionally, the company completed an ‚ÄúATM-type‚Äù capital increase with TOBAM, raising 4.1 million euros to fund 41 BTC. Year-to-date, The Blockchain Group has achieved a BTC Yield of 1,270 % and gains of roughly 508.3 BTC, translating to around 46.7 million euros. Read more: The Blockchain Group Starts 300M-Euro ATM Share Sale to Expand Bitcoin Holdings

title: Will Bitcoin retrace as ‚Äúapparent demand‚Äù signal flips negative?
body: Bitcoin‚Äôs recent price rebound has brought the asset closer to its record highs, but a new on-chain signal may be flashing caution. According to a June 29 analysis by CryptoQuant contributor Crazzyblockk, Bitcoin‚Äôs ( BTC ) ‚Äúapparent demand‚Äù signal has turned negative, indicating that new buyer interest is no longer keeping pace with the supply entering the market from miners and long-term holders. Apparent demand is a metric that compares new buyer interest to the supply entering the market. Specifically, it looks at how much fresh demand is coming in relative to two main sources of supply; the newly mined Bitcoin and long-term holders moving their coins after a period of dormancy. Strong demand offsets this supply and helps push prices higher. A price imbalance may result when apparent demand turns negative, which indicates that new buyers are no longer consuming the available supply. In this case, selling by LTHs, who are often regarded as seasoned, strategic market participants, may suggest that the current price range is a local peak. You might also like: ‚ÄòBitcoin is the hurdle rate‚Äô: What does it mean in the age of crypto? At the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $108,190, up 0.8% in the past 24 hours. The price has moved between $100,546 and $108,706 in the last seven days and currently sits 3% below its all-time high of $111,814 set on May 22. From a technical perspective, Bitcoin is still trading in the upper range of its Bollinger Bands, and the price closing above the 20-day moving average indicates short-term bullish momentum. However, there‚Äôs still a lot of resistance in the $109,000‚Äì$110,000 range. Bitcoin price analysis. Credit: crypto.news At 56.89, the relative strength index is neutral but on the verge of becoming overbought. Bullish control would be re-established with a breakout above $111,000, but a rejection and decline below $105,000 might signal a more significant pullback toward $101,000. Looking ahead, macroeconomic events could have a significant impact on how prices move in the coming days. Traders will be paying close attention to what central bank leaders have to say at the European Central Bank forum this week. Jerome Powell, Federal Reserve Chair, is scheduled to speak on Tuesday, July 1, alongside his counterparts from the UK, South Korea, and Japan.¬†While Powell recently told lawmakers that the Fed is in no rush to cut interest rates, political pressure is mounting. U.S. President Donald Trump criticized Powell for keeping rates ‚Äúartificially high‚Äù on a June 29 interview. In the absence of strong apparent demand and unfavourable macroeconomic projectoons, Bitcoin may struggle to power through resistance without fresh catalysts. Read more: Is the crypto bull run here? Bitcoin wavers as traders take profits

title: The Oracle of Omaha Has a New Disciple in the World of Bitcoin
body: Kiyosaki stresses asset accumulation over timing in Bitcoin investment strategies. Even small Bitcoin purchases, such as one Satoshi, may offer future value for investors. Including crypto in portfolios can lower long-term risk, as supported by MIT Research. Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki has revealed his evolving approach to Bitcoin investment as the asset trades at new highs. Looking back at his own first purchase of Bitcoin at just $6,000 per coin, Kiyosaki admits his early hesitation, which he attributes to a lack of understanding. Now, with Bitcoin trading around $107,000, he says that while the high price remains a psychological barrier for many, it has not stopped him from increasing his own holdings. WHAT IS EXPENSIVE? I was late into Bitcoin. I waited too long‚Ä¶.which may have been a good thing. I waited because I did not understand today‚Äôs modern money. So I bought my first Bitcoin at $6000 a coin. It was expensive. Today I wish I had bought more at $6000. Today‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Robert Kiyosaki (@theRealKiyosaki) June 30, 2025 Kiyosaki‚Äôs New Focus Is on Accumulation The core of Kiyosaki‚Äôs new message is a fundamental shift in mindset. H‚Ä¶ The post The Oracle of Omaha Has a New Disciple in the World of Bitcoin appeared first on Coin Edition .

title: LeverFi mints $13.7B LEVER tokens as Binance delisting looms
body: LeverFi rose to the spotlight last week after Binance announced it would delist it and four other altcoins on July 4, triggering mixed price performances in these tokens . While removal from a top trading platform hurts crypto projects, the latest blockchain transactions from LeverFi have magnified worries among LEVER holders. Notably, the protocol has minted 13.7 billion tokens days before the scheduled delisting. The move has raised questions about the potential effect on LEVER‚Äôs value, transparency, and timing. Nevertheless, the massive token issuance has increased LEVER supply to nearly 56 billion from 35 billion. While the minting matches the team‚Äôs May announcement about the LeverAI staking program, the close timing to the imminent delisting and movement of some of the new coins to Bybit and MEXC has sparked concerns among traders and holders. CryptOpus @ImCryptOpus ¬∑ Follow EXCLUSIVE: 13.7 billion new $lever tokens were added to the leverfi chain, some of which were populated on the #bybit and #mexc exchanges. (the project side is starting to go bad) $LEVER #crypto 1:11 AM ¬∑ Jun 29, 2025 5 Reply Copy link Read 1 reply LeverFi hasn‚Äôt communicated the motive behind the massive token minting as Binance‚Äôs delisting looms. LeverAI and supply cap surge The decentralized protocol announced LeverAI, an AI-powered automation and staking program, on May 15. The team confirmed it would increase the token supply from 35,000,000,000 to 55,786,500,000, with plans to support growth initiatives such as AI developments, ecosystem incentives, and staking rewards. Thus, the latest mint matches the planned tokenomics upgrade. However, the rollout comes amid bearish sentiments as enthusiasts brace for Binance delisting later this week. The absence of real-time updates from the team on the token allocation has intensified worries about the supply expansion. Some suggest that the partial deposit to Bybit could indicate an upcoming dump, especially with Binance ceasing support. However, proponents trust the move is part of liquidity redistribution as LeverFi explores other exchanges. Binance delisting fuels speculations Binance remains crucial for liquidity as it enhances visibility, accessibility, and volume. Therefore, removing support for LEVER means a significant blow. Binance users will no longer access LeverFi‚Äôs native token starting July 4, translating to lower exposure and reduced liquidity. Binance @binance ¬∑ Follow Binance will Delist ALPHA, BSW, KMD, LEVER, LTO on 2025-07-04. üëâ binance.com/en/support/ann‚Ä¶ 5:30 PM ¬∑ Jun 26, 2025 615 Reply Copy link Read 311 replies The exchange delists projects that have failed to impress due to factors like unresponsive teams, lower ecosystem developments, and inactive communities. The LeverFi team should act accordingly to maintain the brand image by cementing its presence on different platforms. Moreover, the protocol has to justify the native token‚Äôs utility using the LeverAI program. Therefore, the team might have conducted the minted for optimistic purposes, including supporting AI-driven expansion, rewarding users, and backing staking pools. However, clarity from the team remains crucial to remove doubts among LEVER enthusiasts. LEVER price outlook Despite the increasing uncertainty, the native token gained over 3% in the previous 24 hours, likely driven by broad market rebounds. Chart by Coinmarketcap However, LEVER will unlikely sustain this rally amid the massive supply increase and delisting debates. It has lost over 20% of its value over the past seven days, reflecting fading market confidence and concerns about token dilution. However, LEVER‚Äôs long-term potential will depend on how the team responds to this pivotal moment. The post LeverFi mints $13.7B LEVER tokens as Binance delisting looms appeared first on Invezz

title: Decoding the Crypto Fear & Greed Index: Crucial Insights for Market Sentiment
body: BitcoinWorld Decoding the Crypto Fear & Greed Index: Crucial Insights for Market Sentiment Are you feeling the pulse of the cryptocurrency market? The Crypto Fear & Greed Index is a powerful tool designed to give you a snapshot of prevailing emotions, helping you understand whether market participants are feeling overly optimistic or overly cautious. As of June 30, this crucial indicator, provided by software development platform Alternative, registered a value of 66. While this is a slight dip from the previous day, it firmly keeps the market in the ‚ÄòGreed‚Äô zone, signaling a continued bullish sentiment despite recent fluctuations. But what does this number truly tell us about the future of Bitcoin price and the broader crypto landscape? Understanding the Crypto Fear & Greed Index: What Does it Mean? The Crypto Fear & Greed Index is more than just a number; it‚Äôs a barometer of the collective emotional state of the cryptocurrency market. Ranging from 0 to 100, it aims to quantify market sentiment, where: 0-24 (Extreme Fear): Indicates investors are highly worried, often leading to selling pressure and potential buying opportunities for brave investors. 25-49 (Fear): Still a cautious market, but less intense than extreme fear. 50-54 (Neutral): A balanced market where neither fear nor greed dominates. 55-74 (Greed): Suggests investors are becoming overly optimistic, potentially leading to overvaluation. 75-100 (Extreme Greed): A highly euphoric market, often a precursor to market corrections as assets become significantly overbought. Historically, moments of extreme fear have often coincided with market bottoms, presenting lucrative entry points for long-term investors. Conversely, periods of extreme greed have frequently preceded market tops, serving as a warning sign for potential pullbacks. How is Crypto Market Sentiment Measured? The brilliance of the Crypto Fear & Greed Index lies in its multi-faceted approach to gauging crypto market sentiment . It doesn‚Äôt rely on a single data point but aggregates information from six key factors, each weighted differently to provide a comprehensive overview. Let‚Äôs break down these components: 1. Volatility (25%) This component measures the current volatility and maximum drawdowns of Bitcoin compared to its average over the last 30 and 90 days. High volatility, especially on the downside, typically indicates fear, while stable or upward volatility might suggest growing confidence. 2. Market Momentum/Volume (25%) This factor analyzes the current volume and market momentum of Bitcoin and compares it with average values. High buying volume in a rising market suggests greedy behavior, while low volume or high selling volume indicates fear. 3. Social Media (15%) The index scours various social media platforms, primarily Twitter (now X), for specific keywords and hashtags related to cryptocurrency. A high number of positive or trending posts often indicates a surge in interest and potentially greedy sentiment, whereas negative sentiment or a lack of engagement can signal fear. 4. Surveys (15%) ‚Äì Currently Paused Although currently paused, this component historically involved weekly polls where thousands of people shared their perceptions of the crypto market. Surveys offer a direct insight into investor psychology, providing a raw measure of fear or greed. The temporary pause means the index currently relies more heavily on the other five factors. 5. Bitcoin Dominance (10%) Bitcoin‚Äôs dominance refers to its market capitalization share relative to the entire cryptocurrency market. An increasing Bitcoin dominance often suggests a flight to safety, indicating fear in the altcoin market as investors consolidate into Bitcoin. Conversely, a decreasing dominance might indicate greed, as investors venture into riskier altcoins for higher potential returns. 6. Google Trends (10%) This factor analyzes Google search queries related to Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies. A sudden surge in searches for terms like ‚ÄòBitcoin price manipulation‚Äô or ‚ÄòBitcoin crash‚Äô indicates fear, while searches for ‚Äòhow to buy Bitcoin‚Äô or ‚ÄòBitcoin bullish‚Äô might suggest growing public interest and potential greed. By combining these diverse data points, the index offers a robust, albeit not infallible, indicator of overall market sentiment. What Does a ‚ÄòGreed‚Äô Zone Reading of 66 Imply for Bitcoin Price? The current reading of 66, firmly in the ‚ÄòGreed‚Äô zone, suggests that investors are generally optimistic about the market‚Äôs future. This level of greed, while not extreme, indicates that many participants are willing to take on more risk, potentially driving prices higher. However, the slight drop from the previous day (down two points) hints at a cooling off of this intense optimism, suggesting that while greed is still prevalent, it might be moderating. This subtle shift could be a healthy sign, preventing the market from becoming excessively overheated and prone to sharp corrections. For Bitcoin price , a ‚ÄòGreed‚Äô reading typically implies continued buying pressure. Historically, sustained periods in the greed zone have preceded significant price rallies. However, it‚Äôs also a reminder that prices cannot go up indefinitely. As the saying goes, ‚Äòbe fearful when others are greedy.‚Äô This moderate greed level might indicate a period of consolidation or minor pullbacks before the next leg up, offering opportunities for strategic entries rather than chasing pumps. Mastering Your Crypto Trading Strategy with the Fear & Greed Index Incorporating the Crypto Fear & Greed Index into your crypto trading strategy can significantly enhance your decision-making, but it‚Äôs crucial to use it wisely. It serves as an emotional compass, not a definitive buy/sell signal. Here‚Äôs how you can leverage it: Contrarian Investing: The most common application. When the index is in ‚ÄòExtreme Fear,‚Äô it might be an opportune time to consider buying, as assets are likely undervalued due to panic selling. Conversely, when it hits ‚ÄòExtreme Greed,‚Äô it might be time to take profits or reduce exposure, as the market could be overbought. Risk Management: During periods of ‚ÄòGreed,‚Äô especially ‚ÄòExtreme Greed,‚Äô consider tightening your stop-losses or reducing position sizes. High sentiment often precedes increased market volatility on the downside. Confirmation Tool: Use the index to confirm other technical or fundamental analysis. If your charts show a potential reversal and the index is showing ‚ÄòExtreme Fear,‚Äô it adds conviction to your bullish outlook. Long-Term vs. Short-Term: For long-term investors, extreme fear can be a signal to accumulate. For short-term traders, the index can help time entries and exits around sentiment-driven swings. Remember, the index is just one piece of the puzzle. Always combine its insights with thorough research, technical analysis, and an understanding of market fundamentals. Never make investment decisions based solely on a single indicator. Navigating Market Volatility: A Key Challenge in Crypto One of the defining characteristics of the cryptocurrency market is its inherent market volatility . Prices can swing wildly in short periods, influenced by a myriad of factors from regulatory news to whale movements, and of course, sentiment. The Crypto Fear & Greed Index helps contextualize this volatility by showing the underlying emotional drivers. When the index fluctuates rapidly between fear and greed, it often signals periods of heightened uncertainty and choppiness. Understanding this relationship can help investors brace for sudden movements and adjust their risk exposure accordingly. For instance, a sharp increase in the index from ‚ÄòFear‚Äô to ‚ÄòGreed‚Äô might precede a strong upward trend, but also indicates increased risk of a sudden correction as euphoria takes hold. Conversely, a sustained period in ‚ÄòFear‚Äô might present a ‚Äòbuy the dip‚Äô opportunity for those comfortable with high risk, anticipating a rebound once the panic subsides. It‚Äôs about recognizing the emotional cycle and not getting swept away by it. The Psychology Behind the Numbers: Why Sentiment Matters At its core, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index taps into the powerful psychological forces that drive financial markets. Human emotions‚Äîfear and greed‚Äîare often the primary catalysts for irrational decisions, leading to market bubbles and crashes. Greed can lead to FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out), causing investors to buy at inflated prices, while fear can lead to panic selling, causing them to sell at a loss. The index provides a quantifiable measure of these emotions, allowing investors to potentially counter their own biases and make more rational choices. Recognizing when the collective market is overly emotional can give you an edge. It‚Äôs about stepping back, assessing the broader sentiment, and making decisions that go against the herd mentality when appropriate. This contrarian approach, famously advocated by legendary investors, is precisely what the index helps facilitate. Conclusion: A Compass, Not a Crystal Ball, for Your Crypto Journey The Crypto Fear & Greed Index remains an invaluable tool for any cryptocurrency enthusiast or investor. While its current reading of 66 places the market firmly in the ‚ÄòGreed‚Äô zone, indicating continued optimism, the slight dip suggests a healthy moderation of this sentiment. It provides crucial insights into crypto market sentiment , helping you gauge the prevailing emotional winds that influence Bitcoin price and the broader digital asset space. By understanding its components and how to integrate it into your crypto trading strategy , you can better navigate the inherent market volatility and avoid emotionally driven mistakes. Remember, no single indicator guarantees success. The index is a compass, not a crystal ball. Use it as part of a comprehensive analytical framework, combining its insights with fundamental analysis, technical indicators, and sound risk management practices. Staying informed and disciplined is key to thriving in the dynamic world of cryptocurrencies. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action. This post Decoding the Crypto Fear & Greed Index: Crucial Insights for Market Sentiment first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Polkadot (DOT): Here‚Äôs How One of Crypto‚Äôs Biggest Bets Faded Into a Ghost Chain
body: Crypto trader Nonzee published a detailed analysis of Polkadot‚Äôs trajectory, presenting a critical assessment of how one of the most heavily funded blockchain projects transitioned from being a major industry contender to what he describes as a ‚Äúghost chain.‚Äù His commentary traces the project‚Äôs history, technological challenges, and the market forces that contributed to its decline. According to Nonzee, Polkadot‚Äôs initial launch was marked by significant enthusiasm and massive financial backing. In 2017, the project raised $144 million within minutes through its initial coin offering (ICO), followed by an additional $43 million in private investment rounds. By 2021, Polkadot (DOT) was widely regarded as an ‚ÄúEthereum killer,‚Äù with its parachain model offering a new approach to Web3 infrastructure. The project introduced its mainnet in 2020 and parachains in late 2021, featuring shared security and scalability that appeared highly promising on paper. Despite this strong start, Nonzee points out that the project struggled with adoption. While the network‚Äôs design was technologically advanced, it ultimately failed to achieve product-market fit. Nonzee emphasizes that Polkadot did not deliver a compelling use case or a widely adopted application that could attract and retain users. At its peak, Polkadot‚Äôs native token, DOT, reached $55 with a market cap of $50 billion. However, Nonzee asserts that this growth was driven more by speculative hype than by genuine network activity. Polkadot is dead. Raised $500M. Promised a revolution. Now? No users. No devs. No future. Here‚Äôs how one of crypto‚Äôs biggest bets faded into a ghost chain pic.twitter.com/XMHElzhOl0 ‚Äî Nonzee (@0xNonceSense) June 27, 2025 Technical Barriers and Developer Attrition A significant part of the issue, as outlined by Nonzee, was the difficulty developers faced when building on Polkadot . The network relies on Substrate and Rust, which he describes as not beginner-friendly compared to Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) chains. This technical complexity introduced friction, discouraging many developers from committing to the ecosystem. As a result, developers gradually shifted focus to other platforms that offered a more accessible development environment. Nonzee also highlights that Polkadot‚Äôs architecture created additional confusion. The existence of both Polkadot and Kusama networks, each with its token, left users uncertain about their distinct roles. This confusion, combined with an unintuitive user experience, deterred both users and developers. The parachain auction model, originally designed to foster network growth, is cited as another critical flaw. Locking DOT tokens for two years to secure parachain slots limited liquidity and hindered project momentum. This model, while innovative in concept, proved unsustainable over time. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Declining Usage and Governance Challenges Nonzee‚Äôs assessment underscores a steady decline in user activity and developer participation between 2021 and 2025. He notes that by 2025, the network had fewer than 5,000 daily active users across all parachains. Developer numbers also fell sharply from 2,400 monthly contributors in 2022 to nearly half that figure by 2024. Governance, once considered one of Polkadot‚Äôs most ambitious features, failed to sustain its intended impact. According to Nonzee, the system became dominated by whales, and treasury expenditures exceeded $129 million in 2024, with little to show in terms of return on investment. As a consequence, voter turnout decreased and community trust eroded significantly. A Technological Marvel Without Adoption Despite the rollout of Polkadot 2.0 in 2024, which introduced improvements, such as async backing, agile coretime, and the JAM protocol, Nonzee argues that these advancements arrived too late to revive the network. The broader market had shifted its attention elsewhere, and DOT‚Äôs value collapsed from $55 to under $5 without any meaningful recovery. In his conclusion, Nonzee remarks that while Polkadot remains a technological achievement featuring reliable components such as XCM and shared security, the absence of users and a compelling narrative renders the network functionally obsolete in its current form. He suggests that unless a real-world killer application emerges to drive adoption, Polkadot will continue to operate as a sophisticated but underutilized infrastructure within the blockchain ecosystem. The views expressed in this article may include the author‚Äôs personal opinions and do not represent Times Tabloid‚Äôs opinion. Readers are advised to conduct thorough research before making any investment decisions. Any action taken by the reader is strictly at their own risk. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. title: 2 Big Possibilities for XRP After Ripple vs SEC Lawsuit Ends
body: The post 2 Big Possibilities for XRP After Ripple vs SEC Lawsuit Ends appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News The long-running legal fight between Ripple and the SEC is finally over. After the official announcement from the Ripple CEO, Brad Garlinghouse, that both sides have decided to drop their appeals, putting a full stop to one of crypto‚Äôs biggest legal battles for good. For XRP holders, this brings relief and fresh hope ‚Äî but also raises a big question: What‚Äôs next for XRP‚Äôs price? Let‚Äôs break it down. 2 Big Possibilities for XRP Now XRP Price Stays the Same The first possibility is that XRP‚Äôs price does not really move much from here. As of now, it is trading around $2.17 , reflecting a slight drop wth a market cap hitting $128.5 billion. Many traders believe the end of the lawsuit was already ‚Äúpriced in.‚Äù This means that investors had expected Ripple to win for a while, so the current price already reflects that hope. If no fresh news comes soon, XRP might just stay flat, moving only with the bigger crypto market for now. Ripple Goes All In With Big Moves The second possibility is far more exciting. With no lawsuit slowing them down, Ripple might go all out. Many in the XRP community believe Ripple could now announce big partnerships, sign new global deals, or roll out new services to boost adoption. This could give XRP a strong push up, as more companies and banks feel safe to use Ripple‚Äôs tech again. To make this happen, Ripple Labs has already partnered with Wormhole , a platform that helps different blockchains connect and work together. On the other hand, some supporters even think Ripple should run a strong marketing campaign, showing the world they‚Äôre not done yet. XRP To BE In U.S Crypto Reserve Apart from this, there is growing excitement around adding XRP as a strategic reserve, alongside Bitcoin. Now that Ripple‚Äôs legal fight with the SEC is over, nothing is stopping XRP from being included in this group. U.S. Crypto Strategic Reserve: #XRP pic.twitter.com/VjCcWXNqFz ‚Äî JackTheRippler ¬© (@RippleXrpie) June 29, 2025 For now, all eyes are on Ripple‚Äôs next move.

title: ONDO price tests key resistance after bouncing off yearly low
body: ONDO price has recently bounced off its yearly low and is now edging closer to a critical resistance level, fueled by a series of recent developments on the fundamental front. Ondo Finance ( ONDO ) price is currently trading at $0.078, up 13% over the past week. The price recently rebounded from a yearly low of $0.62 on June 22, after briefly dipping below the lower trendline of the months-long descending channel on the 4-hour chart. As evident by the volume accompanying the rally from that low, strong buying pressure was present at that level, quickly pulling the price back within the channel‚Äôs range. On the recent candles, ONDO price has also climbed above both the 20 EMA and the 100 SMA, with a bullish crossover forming between the two averages. The price is now approaching the upper boundary of the descending channel, having established a slightly higher high compared to the peak of the initial rally from the yearly low. Source: TradingView You might also like: Ondo Finance forms Global Markets Alliance to establish tokenized securities standards Momentum indicators are also leaning bullish. The Relative Strength Index has climbed to around 59, signaling growing strength but still leaving room before entering overbought territory. The MACD has formed a bullish crossover, with the MACD line moving above the signal line and shifting into positive territory. Looking ahead, a breakout above the upper boundary of the descending channel, around $0.082 to $0.085, could pave the way toward the next targets near $0.090 and potentially $0.105, which correspond to the previous swing highs within the channel. On the downside, the immediate horizontal support lies at $0.072. A breakdown below this level would increase the likelihood that the price remains trapped within the channel in the near term. ONDO price rebound from the yearly low comes on the heels of a string of recent milestones on the fundamental front. Notably, Ondo Finance has recently brought its tokenized U.S. Treasuries to the XRP Ledger, completed a cross-chain settlement leveraging JPMorgan‚Äôs Kinexys and Chainlink, and introduced instant conversion functionality between its OUSG fund and PayPal‚Äôs PYUSD stablecoin. Additionally, the company recently announced the formation of the Global Markets Alliance , a new coalition aimed at establishing technical and compliance standards for tokenized public securities. The alliance brings together key players including the Solana Foundation, Fireblocks, BitGo, Trust Wallet, Bitget Wallet, Jupiter, and Newtoiwkr. The initiative sets the stage for the upcoming launch of Ondo Global Markets, a platform designed to enable applications and wallets to provide direct access to U.S. securities for non-U.S. traders. You might also like: Ondo Finance launches tokenized U.S. Treasuries on XRP Ledger
